thread.title: West Indies opener Chris Gayle to miss two to three months of cricket after back surgery | The
thread.title_full: West Indies opener Chris Gayle to miss two to three months of cricket after back surgery | The Advertiser

title: West Indies opener Chris Gayle to miss two to three months of cricket after back surgery | The
text:
WEST Indies opener Chris Gayle has said he will miss “two to three months” of cricket after electing to have back surgery.
The Jamaica Tallawahs star made the announcement after his side lost its semi-final to Trinidad and Tobago Red Steel.
“I have a charity game on the 2nd, but after that I will be out of cricket for two to three months. I am going to do a surgery on my back,” Gayle said.
STEYN SHOWS OFF FOOTBALL SKILLS
CUMMINS BAGS WICKET ON RETURN
NEVILL’S MISSION: HOLD ONTO THE GLOVES
LANNING LEADS STARS TO VICTORY Gayle battled injury during the 2015 World Cup. Source: Getty Images
“So I need some time for recovery. Maybe December, before I actually get back in cricket as well. You have got to wish me luck with that surgery and then I will be back strong. Who knows, we will see what happens.”
Gayle had problems with his back during the World Cup in Australia, missing a group game against the UAE and taking an injection to play in the quarter-final against New Zealand.
Since then Gayle has been in devastating form for his T20 clubs.
Gayle scored 491 runs from 14 innings for Royal Challengers Bangalore, 328 runs from three innings for Somerset, and currently tops the run-scoring charts in the CPL, with 430 runs at an average of 61.42 for Jamaica Tallawahs. Gayle in action for Somerset. Source: Getty Images
Gayle in contracted to the Melbourne Renegades who will be hoping he is ready for the start of the Big Bash League on December 18,
Originally published as Back surgery to sideline Renegades star Gayle
